ThingDef.label: Talabheim soldier shirt
ThingDef.description: A shirt worn by the Empire soldiers from the state of Talabheim, and bearing its colors: red and white.

ThingDef.label: Talabheim officer shirt
ThingDef.description: A shirt worn by the low level Empire officers from the state of Talabheim, and bearing its colors: red and white.

ThingDef.label: Talabheim high officer shirt
ThingDef.description: A shirt worn by higher ranking Empire officers from the state of Talabheim, and bearing its colors: red and white.

ThingDef.description: A shirt worn by the low level Empire officers from the state of Reikland, and bearing its colors: red accented white (or fawn).

ThingDef.label: Wissenland soldier shirt
ThingDef.description: A shirt worn by the Empire soldiers from the state of Wissenland, and bearing its colors: accented white and grays.

ThingDef.description: A shirt worn by the low level Empire officers from the state of Wissenland, and bearing its colors: accented white and grays.

ThingDef.label: Empire lordly shirt
ThingDef.description: A shirt worn by the Empire lords and nobility.

ThingDef.label: Empire huntsman gambeson
ThingDef.description: A leather gambeson worn by huntsman of the Empire. Good for moving around, while yet providing some protection to the wearer.

ThingDef.label: Empire basic armor
ThingDef.description: Simple Empire armor. Provides good protection from sharp attacks, and some from blunt attacks.

ThingDef.label: Empire basic gilded armor
ThingDef.description: Simple Empire armor that has been gilded with a golden design. Provides good protection from sharp attacks, and some from blunt attacks. Improves social standing, so the grunt will listen to orders.

ThingDef.label: Empire good armor
ThingDef.description: Mid level Empire armor. Provides great protection from sharp attacks, and decent from blunt attacks.

ThingDef.label: Empire superior armor
ThingDef.description: Empire armor worn by the wealthy; elector counts, nobles, etc. Provides great protection all around.

ThingDef.label: Empire knight armor
ThingDef.description: Empire armor worn by the illustrious Empire knights, regardless of the knightly order to which they belong.
A cape that hangs from the shoulders, and covers the back, made from any type of fabric material.
ThingDef.label: Empire cape

ThingDef.description: A fancy jacket worn sleeves off by Empire outrider cavalry. It hangs from the shoulders, and covers the back. Offers protection, and is a display of wealth.
ThingDef.label: Empire outrider jacket
Empire faith armor
ThingDef.description: Empire armor intended for warrior priests. Provides great protection from sharp attacks, and good from blunt attacks.

A long coat for blocking the sun and grit of the outdoors. Worn by witch hunters. Does provide a small level of armor, depending upon what it is made of.\n\nThis duster style coat is one of the signature pieces of apparel for the witch hunters. It's appearance causes fearful thoughts in the minds of the guilty and innocent alike. Tales of torture fill the minds of those being questioned by a witch hunter.
ThingDef.label: Empire witch hunter jacket

ThingDef.description: A mantle made from the pelt of a southern (common) bear.\n\nThis type of mantle has been worn as a status symbol for wealthy and powerful people in the Empire of Man for many generations.
ThingDef.label: southern bear mantle

ThingDef.description: A mantle made from the pelt of a cave bear.\n\nThis type of mantle has been worn as a status symbol for wealthy and powerful people in the Empire of Man for many generations.
ThingDef.label: cave bear mantle

ThingDef.description: A mantle made from the pelt of a great bear.\n\nThis type of mantle has been worn as a status symbol for wealthy and powerful people in the Empire of Man for many generations.
ThingDef.label: great bear mantle

ThingDef.description: A mantle made from the pelt of an ice bear.\n\nThis type of mantle has been worn as a status symbol for wealthy and powerful people in the Empire of Man for many generations.
ThingDef.label: ice bear mantle
